channel.title: Comments on: If you are suffering from Cisco VPN on 64 bit Windows then use the Shrew Soft VPN client
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Ray Robertson
item.dc:creator: Ray Robertson
item.content:encoded:
Cisco have finally released a beta x64 client. I tried it today and had no problems on my Win7 x64 PC.

Filename is vpnclient-winx64-msi-5.0.07.0240-k9-BETA.exe. CCO login required for download.

item.title: By: Andrew Badera
item.dc:creator: Andrew Badera
item.content:encoded:
Good stuff Denis, thanks. I can now connect to that host we were discussing, directly from my x64 primary work machine.

@Eric: is the Cisco AnyConnect Client freely, directly downloadable? I wasn’t able to find a link for it when I looked a month or two ago. Also, I thought AnyConnect was for SSL VPNs only?

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Eric, this probably because your network is also 64 bit...ours isn't :-(
item.content:encoded: Eric, this probably because your network is also 64 bit…ours isn’t üôÅ

item.title: By: Eric Williams
item.dc:creator: Eric Williams
item.description: Interesting, I've been using the Cisco AnyConnect VPN Client from my work on Windows 7 x64 since Windows 7 was in RC/Beta. Maybe I'm missing something ...
item.content:encoded: Interesting, I’ve been using the Cisco AnyConnect VPN Client from my work on Windows 7 x64 since Windows 7 was in RC/Beta. Maybe I’m missing something …
